page.title: 07EDUCATION - POST WAR
page.content:
In l948 after the school in Crantock closed the pupils were admitted to Cubert. At one time the old village hall was used as a classroom and then in l959 an extra building was added. By l975 the first phase of a new school consisting of a hall, library, classroom and kitchen was built in the adjacent field. Further additions of staff facilities and another class- room were completed in l977.
The present staff includes a head, deputy, 2 full and one part-time assistants. There are 2 additional non-teaching posts for special needs and children under 5. A further 9 people are employed as clerk, kitchen and cleaning staff. In July l985 the number on roll was l28. At 11+ the children transfer to Newquay School.
